p: On the other hand, there are several classes of the oral hypoglycemic drugs for type 2 diabetes that point to the various targets in order to restore glucose homeostasis. The main tissues through which oral hypoglycemic drugs exert their glucose-lowering effect are pancreas, liver, skeletal muscle, adipose tissue, and intestine. According to the mechanisms of action we can distinguish multiple drugs that stimulate insulin secretion by the pancreas, increase sensitivity of target organs to insulin and decrease the rate of glucose absorption from the gastrointestinal tract.
